project.teaser: The LIGNOSILVA Centre of Excellence for Forest-based industry stands for a systematic and structural change in the research landscape of the forest-based sector (FBS). The EU has made a strategic turn towards a circular bioeconomy, striving for a low-carbon society based on...
project.objective: The LIGNOSILVA Centre of Excellence for Forest-based industry stands for a systematic and structural change in the research landscape of the forest-based sector (FBS). The EU has made a strategic turn towards a circular bioeconomy, striving for a low-carbon society based on renewable sources, including wood biomass. It requires to transfer of knowledge and brings new innovation into FBS practice. FBS research landscape in Slovakia - as well as in countries with similar political histories - is highly fragmented and loses much of its potential due to insufficiently organised structures and strategies. Moreover, it is not linked to collaboration with Western/Northern EU countries. In the long run, this affects the entire value chain. The overall objective of the CoE is to contribute to overcoming these shortcomings by upgrading the existing LignoSilva Center of Excellence (CoE). The essence of upgrade lies in institutional reform that introduces European science management standards, increases excellence, expands research capacities, digital transformation based on the implementation of Forestry 4.0 and Pulp & Paper 4.0 into CoE research-innovation activities, support for open science and more efficient knowledge transfer to FBS. The main goal is to bring excellent research and applicable innovation into FBS in three research areas: - Intelligent technologies and systems supporting wood production and industrial wood processing. - Pulp and paper technologies for biodegradable packaging and special papers development with multifunctional properties - Recycling technologies and use of cellulose sludge and wood ash CoE LignoSilva's objective will be reached by concentrating the research and infrastructure capacities of the National Forestry Centre and the Pulp and Paper Research Institute in Bratislava. They will build up and foster cooperation with the advanced partners Fraunhofer Wilhelm-Klauditz-Institute (Germany).
project.title: Upgrade of the Centre of Excellence LignoSilva
project.keywords: Forestry 4.0, 3D scanning, wood biomass, wood flow, pulp-paper technologies, biodegradable packaging, Smart, packaging, special papers, Pulp and Paper 4.0, recycling, cellulose sludges, wood ash

article.title: Upgrading forest-based sector research in Slovakia

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - LignoSilva (Upgrade of the Centre of Excellence LignoSilva)
result.teaser: VISION: The vision of CoE LignoSilva is to be a key factor that will support the sustainable development of the forest-wood and pulp & paper sector based on the synergy of excellent science and practice.With its focus, CoE reflects the need to transform the sector into an...
result.description: periodic

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

webItem.alternativeText: LignoSilva governance structure and management diagram

result.title: Plan of SAB and IAB activities
result.description: The Executive Board (EB) will consist of a representative of 3 CoE partners. EB will establish the Scientific and Industry Advisory Boards (advises on research and innovation portfolios only). The Scientific and Industry Advisory Boards will agree on the plan of SAB, and IAB activities for the entire duration of the project.

result.title: Guide of premises & marketing brand manual
result.description: The facility and infrastructure desks manage the process of facility management as well as the administration of the overall building and office complex. A description of facilities, their purpose and their use will be elaborated (Guide of CoE premises & facilities). Under the overall marketing strategy and LIGNOSILVA corporate identity, the manual of uses of CoE graphic symbols on all types of facilities will be developed.

result.title: Workshops & Round tables with stakeholders
result.description: Targeted CoE events (2 workshops and 3 round tables) will be organised and focused on:- Presentation of the services, products and best practices from 8 demonstration cases (DC) and new knowledge from preparatory research projects (workshops).- The CoE business strategy and market uptake of innovative ideas and building a bridge to industry (round tables).Events will be organised in M7, M28 and M27.

result.title: Upgrated CoE Bussines Plan
result.description: Strategic planning: NFC and WKI will upgrade of CoE Business plan (from 2016) for the next 6 years. The business plan includes a strategic project plan, personnel management plan, financial plan, and sustainability plan. The business plan will be a framework for other planning documents (guides, manuals, roadmaps, programs, catalogues, specific IPR, market & business strategy and specific plans like procurement or infrastructure operation plan). WKI will assist with the project management and controlling processes that are vital for the success of the centre, coming out from the business plan and related documents.

result.title: Fast spread of Corythucha arcuata (Say, 1832) (Hemiptera: Tingidae) in Slovakia during the period 2020–2022

details.authors: Zúbrik Milan; Barta Marek; Nikolov Christo; Rell Slavomír; Kunca Andrej; Gubka Andrej; Vakula Jozef; Galko Juraj; Leontovyč Roman; Lalík Michal; Kulfan Jan

result.title: Infrastructure operation plan and Prising framework for services
result.description: An infrastructural use plan will be provided for managing the CoE Large infrastructure (i.e. 3D CT scanner, Paper incubator), including promoting it within the Forest based industry network and developing tools/methods to measure benefits.A Costing & Pricing Framework for services offered by the CoE will be developed by accepted management accounting principles. This will ensure sustainable income to cover infrastructural maintenance.The update of the deliverable will be elaborated in M40.

result.title: Project procurement management plan
result.description: A Project Procurement Management Plan will be created ensuring that investments related to engineering equipment are enforceable and linked to the budget. A schedule of detailed preparation activities includes the Survey, Site Investigation, Preparation of Design Plans, Preparation of Technical Specifications, and Preparation of Quantity and Cost Estimates. Based on that, bidding documents will be prepared to provide prospective bidders with all the necessary information. All procurements will follow the Public Procurement Act No. 343/2015.

result.title: Intelligent grading of wood and cutting pattern using 3D CT scanning
result.description: The demonstration case main objectives is to demonstrate the assets of 3D CT scanning and non-destructive wood testing through workshops, target visits, and practical training of foresters and wood processors. Actions will focus on virtual grading with the generation of the optimal sawing pattern to maximize revenues from the sale and wood processing. Through open calls for doctoral and postdoctoral fellows, the collaborative research and use of the unique 3D CT infrastructure as an open laboratory will be strengthened. The market products (Optimize your online cutting plan; Choose a log for auctions; Certify the supply of logs) will be developed and promoted.DC will be presented/demostrated continuously, and the progress of CSA activities will be summarized in M16, M36 and M70.Note: Deliverable is listed in the project proposal under number D5.2-1

result.title: CoE Bio-based stakeholder forum report
result.description: CoE aims to strengthen synergies and coherence between research, innovation and policies related to the Forest-based bioeconomy at the regional, national and macro-regional levels of Central and Eastern Europe in the CoE priority areas. Interconnections will be discussed through the LignoSilva stakeholder forum, which includes: Research and educational organizations and universities; industrial and professional associations and clusters operating in FBS; Research funding agencies; NGOs; National and regional bodies of state administration and self-government.The conclusions of the forums (M14, M38, M66) will be used by the CoE bodies in formulating/reformulating the centre's scientific focus and activities toward the business environment. Stakeholder forums will be organized with the CoE scientific conference Bioeconomy Science-Business summit.

result.title: Open bank of 3D scans of wood logs for research purposes, diploma and doctoral theses
result.description: The open bank of 3D CT scans of wood logs from different tree species (beech, oak, ash, linden, maple, spruce, pine) will be available for doctoral and postdoctoral CoE fellows. The open bank will also be the data source for MSc and PhD theses and collaborative research with universities.The first version of the open bank will be available in the 12th month, updated databank in M36.Note: Deliverable is listed in the project proposal under number D5.2-2

details.authors: Tomáš Bucha; Pavel Pavlenda; Bohdan Konôpka; Julián Tomaštík; Juliána Chudá; Peter Surový

result.title: Identification of drought-induced forest damage in 2022 and of its key site condition drivers through satellite imagery

details.authors: Tomáš Bucha, Pavel Pavlenda, Bohdan Konôpka, Julián Tomaštík , Juliána Chudá, Peter Surový
details.publisher: National Forest Centre & Czech University of Life Sciences

result.title: Assessing the influence of ruminating ungulates on forest regeneration and young stands in Slovakia: results from the National Forest Inventory
Implementation report 1
result.description: The implementation report is a mandatory document for monitoring the progress of the project. The reports will contain details of the supplementary funding according to the prescribed template.Implementation Reports will be submitted at Month 18, Month 36, Month 54 and Month 72.

result.title: CoE Science-Business summit proceedings
result.description: Proceedings from the presentations of scientific results in the Bioeconomy Science-Business Summit will be issued in M17, M38 and M66.

result.title: Dissemination and exploitation plan
result.description: The partners established a systematic dissemination management process that checks and validates the progress of the dissemination & exploitation plan. The editorial & media team (ET) will be established. Every partner nominates one person to the team. It will (i) collect scientific papers from researchers, policy-related documents from the Desks and working groups, and outputs from the 8 DCs and outreach events. Based on these materials ET will (ii) create the content for defined media and channels, e.g. website articles and newsletters, information brochures, press, social media accounts etc. in English and Slovak.The first version of the plan for dissemination and exploitation will be prepared in M06. Updated version in M70.

result.title: Job catalogue, mobility and exchange program
result.description: Human Resources Management covers the acquisition of new experts to strengthen the current capacities of the CoE in both, (i) scientific realms and (ii) the CoE Front office. For both, catalogues of requirements on the professional skills and selection criteria will be developed and applied to hire new experts.Career paths development of CoE staff will be organised and applied through Mobility & Exchange program. Mobility costs are budgeted for CoE members for participation of the CoE experts in courses, conferences and workshops; Benchmarking and networking visits; Study missions and visits (inward and outward). Procedures will be defined and implemented by the Facility desk with the support of back-office services according to GUIDE of Joint Success (employee and employer).

result.title: CoE Open day
result.description: LignoSilva will present results through its flagship event: Centre of Excellence (CoE) Open Day. All infrastructure will be open and demonstrated to the students, the public and potential customers. Presentation and educational materials will be prepared, presented and disseminated.CoE Open Day will be organised in M16, M40 and M64.

result.title: Updated CoE website
result.description: Updated will be the structure and design of the present LignoSilva website and LignoSilva facebook: http://lignosilva.nlcsk.org/ https://www.facebook.com/LignoSilva.NLC/After updating the webpage structure and design, the webpage/facebook will be actualised continuously. The redesign and continual actualisation of the project website will be coordinated with all partners to address different target groups of LIGNOSILVA.

result.title: Guide for Joint Success
result.description: The GUIDE of JOINT SUCCESS - GJS (employee and employer) will be elaborated with the aim to support structural changes leading to a modernized and more competitive R&I system. The CoE will use the expertise of the NFC (back-office services: Human resource management units, Project implementation unit, Legal department) and advanced partner to develop the behaviour stimulating innovation: Zero tolerance to faults from the CoE management; loyalty to CoE; Gender equality; Flexible work environment for the specific conditions of the CoE.GJS will include procedures for recruitment, evaluation and remuneration by EU standards and directives and measures for staff training policy, increasing qualifications and career development.

details.authors: Bohdan Konôpka; Vladimír Šebeň; Jozef Pajtík

result.title: CoE grant scheme and plan of calls
result.description: "The intention is to open the CoE research program to new ideas and international cooperation and to integrate new scientific personnel into the research projects. For this reason, ""preparatory research projects"" will be supported by issuing grants-based calls focusing on young scientists through the CoE Grant scheme. In cooperation with universities and secondary vocational schools operating, the Student Scientific Activity will be initiated and supported every year in the form of awards for the best works.The grant-based calls for young scientists will be open in the 12th., 24th, 36th and 48th months."

result.title: Manual of management
result.description: A management manual will be created. It will regulate the details of the organizational structure, activities and management of the unit, competence, and decision making.Further, the management manual provides a set of procedures and tools for administrative, contractual and day-to-day coordination, quality, conflict and risk management.

result.title: Data management plan
result.description: Data Management Plan: the aim is to make data „as open and re-usable as possible”. The data sharing will be implemented in three ways described in chapter 2.2 Strategy for knowledge management.The update of the deliverable will be elaborated in the 36th month.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
